## spawnPHPWorkerThread() function

spawnPHPWorkerThread<!-- -->(\
&emsp;&emsp;&emsp;<!-- -->workerUrl<!-- -->: [string](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/2/everyday-types.html#the-primitives-string-number-and-boolean)<!-- -->, \
&emsp;&emsp;&emsp;<!-- -->workerBackend?<!-- -->: "webworker"<!-- -->|<!-- -->"iframe"<!-- -->, \
&emsp;&emsp;&emsp;<!-- -->startupOptions?<!-- -->: [Record](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#recordkeys-type)<!-- -->&lt;[string](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/2/everyday-types.html#the-primitives-string-number-and-boolean)<!-- -->,[string](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/2/everyday-types.html#the-primitives-string-number-and-boolean)<!-- -->&gt;\
)<!-- -->: [Promise](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise)<!-- -->&lt;<!-- -->Window<!-- -->|<!-- -->Worker<!-- -->&gt;

-   `workerUrl` – The absolute URL of the worker script.
-   `workerBackend` – Optional. The Worker Thread backend to use. Either 'webworker' or 'iframe'.
-   `startupOptions` – Optional.
-   Returns: The spawned Worker Thread.

Spawns a new Worker Thread.
